{{title|Diagnostic directives}}
{{cpp/preprocessor/navbar}}

Shows the given error message and renders the program ill-formed{{rev inl|since=c++23|, or shows the given warning message without affecting the validity of the program}}.

===Syntax===
{{sdsc begin}}
{{sdsc|num=1|{{ttb|#error}} {{spar|diagnostic-message}}}}
{{sdsc|num=2|notes={{mark since c++23}}|{{ttb|#warning}} {{spar|diagnostic-message}}}}
{{sdsc end}}

===Explanation===
@1@ After encountering the {{c|#error}} directive, an implementation displays the message {{spar|diagnostic-message}} and renders the program ill-formed (the compilation stops).

@2@ Same as {{v|1}}, except the validity of the program is not affected and the compilation continues.

{{spar|diagnostic-message}} can consist of several words not necessarily in quotes.

===Notes===
Before its standardization in C++23, {{c|#warning}} has been provided by many compilers in all modes as a conforming extension.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#if __STDC_HOSTED__ != 1
#   error "Not a hosted implementation"
#endif

#if __cplusplus &gt;= 202302L
#   warning "Using #warning as a standard feature"
#endif

#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "The implementation used is hosted\n";
}
|p=true
|output=
The implementation used is hosted
}}
